summary: Inspired by design, my mission is to connect challenges with creative solutions.

awards.title: National Winner of VegaVibe
awards.description: Vega is a tertiary education institution with four locations across South Africa, and in 2019 held the National competition, VegaVibe, with the opportunity to win a cash prize. Along with three other Elkanah House students, I part-took in this competition, needing to re-brand a given client, as well as propose new innovative initiatives. After 5 to 6 hours of collaborating and building up our final proposal, we presented our ideas to the judges and fellow competition. My team proudly won the competition both in Cape Town, and nationally, gifting the cash prize to the school and representing the first time Elkanah House had ever won.

certifications.name: Tour Visuals & Video Editing Online Course

profile_positions.description:
Ever since watching the American television series, Ugly Betty, my dream has been to work for a magazine. Combining my love for graphic design, editorial design, photography, fashion and news.

I’ve been working alongside the L&B team since early December, and have served as the single graphic designer for the 7 issues we have completed since then. Roughly two weeks before the magazine is released I am sent all the articles and a theme, it is then up to me to gather assets and configure the design and layout. Honestly, this is a true test of working creatively under pressure but I thoroughly enjoy it and have advanced may skills in graphic design massively since the beginning.

I've attached my favourite two issues to this post.
profile_positions.title: Lead Graphic Designer

profile_positions.description:
Working at the Poketaria has been one of the best experiences of my life! As my first role in hospitality, I got to gain a lot of insights behind the scenes.

The Poketaria is a fairly small company and for several months of my time there I was one of the only employees. This meant I had many responsibilities and served as my boss’ right hand. I have learnt to become a great listener of customer needs, which has enabled me to deliver a fulfilling customer experience. Because I'm tasked with many activities in the restaurant, my job requires close attention to detail. Additionally, I have picked up a fair amount of the Dutch language through my time spent here.

I am very grateful for the challenges and lessons the Poketaria has presented me with.
profile_positions.title: Food Server

profile_positions.description:
During the start of my studies in the midst of the pandemic in 2020, I decided to embark on an another au pairing journey. As such, I found a wonderful family with three kids under the age of 8 whom I stayed with for a year and learnt a lifetimes worth of lessons.

At first, the position required a lot of adaptation as I was living in a multinational environment. I had to learn how to read them, learn from their actions, understand how they live, make them feel comfortable in my presence and make myself comfortable in their presence.

Additionally, I have mastered the skill of planning and staying consistent with a schedule. As well as, to be agile and make quick impromptu decisions when problems occur. There were plenty times where the parental responsibility fell on my shoulders to satisfy the needs and wants of the three children. I was happy to be trusted and given the responsibility of looking after the children. Acknowledging my responsibilities, I learnt how to lead without additional help or advice, ensuring not to doubt myself or panic.

Lastly, due to the fact that I chose to partake in full-time studies while being a full-time au pair, I quickly learnt the importance of prioritising tasks and work-life balance. This past year I have learnt so much about my self-dedication and motivation and how I navigate my work under pressure. I can now happily say that it was my most challenging yet successful experience.
profile_positions.title: Au Pair

profile_positions.description:
Between finishing high school in December 2019 and starting university in September 2020, I knew I had an 8 month window to explore life outside my comfort zone. It would’ve been easy for me to take a much needed break at home in Cape Town, but I knew it wouldn't aid my personal development. After considering my options, I decided to au pair in Switzerland. Switzerland was the most attractive destination due to its beautiful, dreamy, and picturesque landscapes. 

I au paired in Zurich for a family with a 4 year-old son. I booked my flights and was off on my newest adventure! This was my first experience as an au pair, and my host family’s first time having an au pair. I worked for the family for 4 months and it was an invaluable experience. Being an au pair taught me so much about my value as a person, honest communication, and how to take care of myself, and others.
profile_positions.title: Au Pair

profile_positions.description:
During the pandemic, I took advantage of my time and decided to complete an online Graphic Design course. At the time, I had a long-standing interest in design, and at one point considered majoring in Graphic Design. I mentioned to my employer that I was completing a Graphic Design course and she immediately took interest. At the time, my employer and her husband were relaunching a family owned restaurant in Zurich, and she wanted me to design a flyer for their restaurant. They were thrilled with the results! Later, I also designed the restaurant menu, as well as other personal family projects. My employer recommended me to her friends, and I designed yet another paid flyer for a gardening and home business.

Although they were only a few projects, I learnt a lot from my experience designing for clients. The main lesson I learnt was that there is absolutely no harm in trying something different, even if you aren’t highly skilled in it. For example, I hadn’t yet finished the Graphic Design course before I landed my first client. This gave me the confidence that I had the ability to design, and that I would get better with practice.

Additionally, I witnessed the power of "word of mouth" marketing. If I hadn’t spoken about the course I was doing, I never would have landed any clients. Working with clients is fun, and freelancing is  something I'd love to continue in the future.
profile_positions.title: Graphic Designer

profile_positions.location: Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa
profile_positions.description:
When I was 17-18 I started to tutor for extra cash. The boy I tutored was 13 and I helped him grasp a greater understanding of Mathematics and English First Language. I tutored the client twice a week and we noticed improvements of up to 30% in his test results. After a while, I had more clients seeking my services.

The opportunity was great for me to pass on what I had learnt to those younger than me. Additionally, providing the service encouraged me to evaluate different methodologies to best fit and enhance the client's results. I am appreciative of this experience because it taught me patience and adaptability.
profile_positions.title: Private Tutor

profile_positions.location: Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa
profile_positions.description:
In 2018, my close friend entered a giveaway for a small e-commerce business named NOWNOW. After a weeks wait, my friend and I were announced as winners to take part in the company's first product shoot which was later used as marketing material for their website.NOWNOW was a start up that aimed to be South Africa’s first marketplace for local fashion designers, serving as an intermediary between local brands and customers.

I loved taking part in this new and exciting concept and doing my part in the marketing so it could have a successful launch. Although it was only two days of work, I got to network with inspiring creatives.
profile_positions.title: Model

profile_positions.location: Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa
profile_positions.description:
Since 2016 I developed a love for sustainable fashion through purchasing second-hand items and vintage clothing. To celebrate my love for slow fashion, a good friend and I decided to host our own secondhand market clothing and afterparty. My friend was moving at the time, and we planned for the event to be hosted the day the house was completely empty. It was quite a spontaneous idea which left us with one week to prepare, but we did our best to ensure a successful event.

Furthermore, my friend and I designed the logo together on Adobe Photoshop and advertised our event through Facebook and Instagram. We wanted to accommodate more styles and sizes, so we arranged for additional small businesses to come and sell their goods at our event. Our idea for the event was to have the secondhand market run till the late afternoon, and then turn the event into an afterparty consisting of local DJs.

This was a great experience for me to trial being an event coordinator as it was something I hadn't done before. I had so much fun planning, co-ordinating and marketing the event and learnt a lot of valuable lessons. In conclusion, the event was a success, but it was noted that had planned further in advance it would have been an even greater success.
profile_positions.title: Event Coordinator

volunteer_experiences.description: At Elkanah House high school, there is a program ran by Mr Le Roux and a large team of students called Social Outreach. Although this program was literally quite limitless, it involved “loving beyond self” in the forms of giving to others who are less privileged. In South Africa, we are exposed to poverty and townships almost all the time, and it is impossible to turn a blind eye to. And this program gives us the opportunity to help out where we can. I was a part of this team for my final three years at Elkanah House, mostly helping run events and the usual Friday projects. The Friday projects were ran for three hours and consisted of students either traveling to under privileged schools in rural areas or an old age home to spend time with those people. Some students stayed at the school and knitted blankets for mothers with premature babies or make sandwiches to later hand out. Personally, this was my favorite part of the week by having the opportunity to give back to others, even if it is only my time and to literally see how it changes their lives and brings such immense joy. Having interacted with this first-hand I will always want to give back in some form or another for the rest of my life.

Before becoming an Au Pair in January 2020, I was still located in South Africa with some time on my hands and was seeking ways to increase my childcare experience before starting the job. I reached out to The Learning Tree Educare close to my home, to volunteer for a week. Each day I rotated to different classes dealing with different ages of children from 2 years to 10 years old. This was certainly a wake-up call for me as children require lots of patience, attention, selflessness and care. I learnt a lot about how to entertain different ages, as well as how to promote correct behavior and brain development. This certainly helped me later on in my Au Pairing experiences.
